body.p: The framework customization can define actions which appear on a special toolbar when editing content in the Author visual editing mode.
A defined Author action has a name, description, icons, menu shortcuts and you can define for it various XPath-enabled activation modes.
In each activation mode you can invoke a variety of pre-defined operations in order to:

li.p: Insert an XML fragment in the document either at the caret position or at a specified offset.
Set an attribute with a certain value on a certain element.
Invoke an XSLT script using an XSLTOperation which produces an XML fragment to insert in the document.
Invoke a Javascript function which can use the Author APIs to modify the document. Some sample such operations can be found here: .
Set a CSS pseudo class on a certain element, pseudo class which can be matched from the CSS to style various elements differently.

body.p: You can also create custom Author operations by extending the AuthorOperation Java API: .
Once an Author action was created, it can be added to the main Author menu, to the Author toolbar or to the contextual menu: .
